Package org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt

Class StateReducer

java.lang.Object
org.svvrl.goal.core.aut.opt.StateReducer
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutomatonOptimizer<Automaton>
public class StateReducer
extends java.lang.Object
implements AutomatonOptimizer<Automaton>
A StateReducer provides methods for removing dead states and unreachable states in an automaton. For an NBW, a state is dead if it cannot reach a cycle containing at least on accepting state.
Author:
Conion Wu, ported by Ming-Hsien Tsai

    • removeDead

      public static void removeDead​(AbstractAltAutomaton aut)
      Removes states that have no successors in an alternating automaton. If the automaton is two-way, the states removed must not be final states.
      Parameters:
      aut - a possibly two-way alternating automaton

    • getDeadStates

      public static StateSet getDeadStates​(FSA aut)
      Returns a set of dead states in an automaton.
      Parameters:
      aut - an automaton
      Returns:
      dead states in the automaton

    • removeDead

      public static void removeDead​(Automaton aut)
      Removes dead states. A state is dead if it is not in any accepting run.
      Parameters:
      aut - an automaton

    • optimize

      public void optimize​(Automaton aut)
      Description copied from interface: AutomatonOptimizer
      Simplifies a specified automaton without changing its language.
      Specified by:
      optimize in interface AutomatonOptimizer<Automaton>
      Parameters:
      aut - an automaton to be simplified
